title: Azure Files missing x-ms-file-request-intent
body: #### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org` https://forum.rclone.org/t/azure-file-share-assistance-needed/48450 #### What is the problem you are having with rclone? Access to azure files fails due to new header requirements from MSFT (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/files/authorize-oauth-rest?tabs=portal#privileged-access-and-access-permissions-for-data-operations) #### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`) rclone v1.68.2 - os/version: Microsoft Windows Server 2022 Datacenter Azure Edition 21H2 (64 bit) - os/kernel: 10.0.20348.2819 (x86_64) - os/type: windows - os/arch: amd64 - go/version: go1.23.3 - go/linking: static - go/tags: cmount #### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit) N/A - issue manifests on both Windows and Linux OS #### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive) Azure Files #### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`) rclone ls remote:share #### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`) 2024/12/10 18:51:07 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "[storagename]:" "-vv"] 2024/12/10 18:51:07 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "[storagename]:" 2024/12/10 18:51:07 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\user\\AppData\\Roaming\\rclone\\rclone.conf" 2024/12/10 18:51:07 ERROR : : error listing: GET https://[storagename].file.core.windows.net/share1/ -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- RESPONSE 400: 400 An HTTP header that's mandatory for this request is not specified.
